description: The U.S. Access Board promotes equality for people with disabilities through leadership in accessible design and the development of accessibility guidelines and standards under the Americans with Disabilities Act and other laws.  The Boards guidelines and standards cover access to the built environment, transit vehicles, information and communication technology, and medical diagnostic equipment.  The Board also provides technical assistance and training to the public on these requirements and enforces accessibility standards that apply to federally funded facilities under the Architectural Barriers Act.
name: United States Access Board
